intro: Dombeya ameliae var. louvelii, commonly known as the Louvel's dombeya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and features hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry forest or scrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
